sentences: David Van Cortlandt Crosby (born August 14, 1941) is an American singer-songwriter and musician.
Crosby joined the Byrds in 1964.
Bob Dylan gave the band their first number one hit in April 1965 with "Mr. Tambourine Man".
Crosby appeared on the Byrds' first five albums and produced the original lineup's 1973 reunion album.
In 1967 he joined Buffalo Springfield on stage at the Monterey Pop Festival, which contributed to his dismissal from the Byrds.
In 1967 he joined Buffalo Springfield on stage at the Monterey Pop Festival, which contributed to his dismissal from the Byrds.
He subsequently formed Crosby, Stills & Nash in 1968 with Stephen Stills (of Buffalo Springfield) and Graham Nash of the Hollies.
He subsequently formed Crosby, Stills & Nash in 1968 with Stephen Stills (of Buffalo Springfield) and Graham Nash of the Hollies.
After the release of their debut album CSN won the Grammy Award for Best New Artist of 1969.
Meant to be a group that could collaborate freely, Crosby and Nash recorded three gold albums in the 1970s, while the core trio of CSN remained active from 1976 until 2016.
Meant to be a group that could collaborate freely, Crosby and Nash recorded three gold albums in the 1970s, while the core trio of CSN remained active from 1976 until 2016.
Meant to be a group that could collaborate freely, Crosby and Nash recorded three gold albums in the 1970s, while the core trio of CSN remained active from 1976 until 2016.
CSNY reunions took place in each decade from the 1970s through the 2000s.
CSNY reunions took place in each decade from the 1970s through the 2000s.
CSNY reunions took place in each decade from the 1970s through the 2000s.
He wrote "Almost Cut My Hair" and the title track "Déjà Vu" for Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young's 1970 album.
He is outspoken politically and has been depicted as emblematic of the 1960s' counterculture.
Crosby is the subject of the 2019 documentary David Crosby: Remember My Name, which was produced by Cameron Crowe.

sentences: After the group split, Raymond has continued to perform with Crosby as part of the touring bands for C&N and CSN, as well as on solo Crosby projects, including 2014's Croz and the subsequent tour, for which he served as musical director.

sentences: Crosby, then 45, married Jan Dance, then 35, in May 1987 at the Hollywood Church of Religious Science in Los Angeles.

sentences: Since 1997, Raymond has performed with Crosby on stage and in the studio, as a member of CPR and as part of the touring bands for Crosby & Nash and Crosby, Stills & Nash.
section: == Personal life == | === Family ===

sentences: In addition, Crosby has three other children: a daughter, Erika, with Jackie Guthrie, a daughter, Donovan Crosby, with former girlfriend Debbie Donovan and a son, Django Crosby, who was conceived with wife Jan Dance after extensive fertility treatments while Crosby's liver was failing.
section: == Personal life == | === Family ===

sentences: In January 2000, Melissa Etheridge announced that Crosby was the sperm donor of two children with her then partner Julie Cypher by means of artificial insemination.
section: == Personal life == | === Family ===

sentences: On May 13, 2020, Etheridge announced on her Twitter that her and Cypher's son Beckett had died of causes related to opioid addiction at the age of 21.
section: == Personal life == | === Family ===

sentences: Crosby's brother Ethan, who taught him to play guitar and started his musical career with him, committed suicide in late 1997 or early 1998; the date is unknown because Ethan left a note not to search for his body but to let him return to the earth.

sentences: He publicly questioned the report of the Warren Commission covering the Assassination of John F. Kennedy onstage during the Byrds' appearance at the Monterey Festival in 1967.
section: == Personal life == | === Politics ===

sentences: For the 2020 presidential election, he said in an interview that Mayor Pete Buttigieg was his favorite candidate for president and that he is smarter than all the others combined; however, he eventually voted for Bernie Sanders.

sentences: Although Crosby was against Joe Biden's candidacy during the 2020 presidential primaries, he voiced a more positive assessment following Biden's general election victory in November.

sentences: Also in 1985, Crosby was arrested for drunken driving, a hit-and-run driving accident, and possession of a concealed pistol and drug paraphernalia.
section: == Personal life == | === Drug, alcohol, and legal issues ===

sentences: On March 7, 2004, Crosby was charged with criminal possession of a weapon in the third degree, illegal possession of a hunting knife, illegal possession of ammunition, and illegal possession of about one ounce of marijuana.
section: == Personal life == | === Drug, alcohol, and legal issues ===

sentences: After spending 12 hours in jail, he was released on $3,500 bail.
section: == Personal life == | === Drug, alcohol, and legal issues ===

sentences: On July 4, 2004, he pleaded guilty in New York State Supreme Court to attempted criminal possession of a weapon and was fined $5,000 and given no jail time.
section: == Personal life == | === Drug, alcohol, and legal issues ===

sentences: Crosby was the recipient of a highly publicized liver transplant in 1994, which was paid for by Phil Collins.

sentences: At a concert in October 2008, Crosby, looking much thinner than in recent years, announced to the audience that he had recently shed 55 pounds as a result of his struggles with the disease.
